item.description:
Come To  Carnevale!

.... at the Isabella Stewart Gardner Museum.   An evening of music, and art.  And of course a visit to the museum courtyard in the middle of winter is a treat all by itself!

And jazz!   The Ron Savage Trio.

"Infusing the classic jazz trio sound with bebop, contemporary, and world music influences, the Ron Savage Berklee Trio offers an eclectic, electric evening of sonic exploration."

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Gardner After Hours Program:

6-9pm Courtyard Music
6-9pm Sketching in the Galleries
6-8pm Gallery Game
6:30pm Gallery Talk on Tapestry (Radio On): New Work by Victoria Morton at the Gardner
7-9pm Studio Art Making
6, 7, and 8pm Spotlight Talks

Venice is our inspiration tonight--as it was for Isabella Gardner when she created the museum over one hundred years ago. Transport yourself to Venezia at the Gardner!

Jazz at the Gardner is also part of Gardner After Hours, and the Ron Savage Berklee Trio performs tonight. Tickets to Jazz at the Gardner concerts are sold separately, but include admission to Gardner After Hours.

 

 

For information on getting tickets to the Ron Savage Trio, in the modern Calderwood Hall:
http://www.gardnermuseum.org/calendar/events/4060

 

Note tickets to the Ron Savage Trio concert include admission to the museum and to the
Gardner After Dark events.  I'll be going to the Ron Savage Trio concert.

 

Or:

 

For those who prefer just the Gardner After Hours tickets, see:


http://www.gardnermuseum.org/calendar/events/4205
item.how_to_find_us: We'll meet in the lobby where the tickets counter is.
item.name: Carnevale! Jazz & Isabella after hours....
